Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the viewership of the State of the Union address compared to the Super Bowl.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Super Bowl had double the viewership of the State of the Union address.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by any evidence or reliable sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the State of the Union address had more viewers than the Super Bowl based on a false claim circulating on social media.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the Super Bowl had more viewers than the State of the Union address.
